intro: Calamaria flaccida, commonly known as the soft calamaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Calamaria flaccida is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
